properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A front over the Alaska Panhandle will move onto the north coast of B.C. late this afternoon and reach the central coast tonight. As the front passes, about 50 mm of heavy rain is expected for coastal areas before easing overnight. The rain combined with melting snow at higher elevations may contribute to increased risk of localised flooding or washouts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T10:08:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T18:09:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2660917671.2020
Area: North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong westerly winds, with wind gusts approaching 90 km/h, are expected to develop late this afternoon and will continue into this evening and overnight. Winds are forecast to diminish Tuesday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T08:27:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T16:28:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1715096450.2020
Area: M.D. of Greenview near Grande Cache Botten and Amundson, M.D. of Greenview near Kakwa Wildland Prov. Park and Nose Lake, Yellowhead Co. near William A. Switzer Prov. Park, Yellowhead Co. near Big Berland and the Wildhay River, Willmore Wilderness Park, Yellowhead Co. near Hinton and Obed Lake Prov. Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. A frontal system has brought a wintry mix of snow and freezing rain to many inland communities on the North Coast last night. Freezing rain will end later this morning as temperatures rise above zero. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-26T23:36:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T14:00:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3789309687.2020
Area: North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By Town Of Lashburn
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for Town of Lashburn due to depressurization caused by line maintenance. This advisory applies to residents and users located on 2nd Street East between Ross Avenue and Cressman Avenue effective October 26, 2020.
Expires: 2020-10-30T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Lashburn, 2020-10-26T09:46:43-06:00, 597CA01C-DFF0-7A48-AB67-7A61E95B3945
Area: Town of Lashburn on 2nd Street East between Ross Avenue and Cressman Avenue
properties.Author: SK Lashburn

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. Heavy snow is forecast to develop today and taper off by Tuesday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T02:32:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T10:33:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1096568998.2020
Area: Ft. Simpson Region including Jean Marie River, Wrigley Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A front over the Alaska Panhandle will move onto the north coast of B.C. late this afternoon and reach the central coast tonight. The front will then stall on Tuesday and remain over the area. Heavy rain is expected to begin tonight and continue into Tuesday night. Rainfall amounts of 50 to 70 mm over inland areas and near 100 mm over coastal areas are forecast by midnight Tuesday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T10:08:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T18:09:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0574990200.2020
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections, Central Coast - inland sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: First accumulating snowfall of the season expected for many areas. Total snowfall: near 5 cm, with higher amounts over elevated terrain. Locations: central, western and northern Newfoundland. Time span: late tonight through Tuesday. Remarks: Snow is expected to begin over western Newfoundland near midnight tonight and will spread into central and northern parts of the island by early Tuesday morning. The snow will change to rain over most areas by midday on Tuesday, but may persist through Tuesday afternoon and evening over parts of the Northern and Baie Verte Peninsulas, especially over higher terrain. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate. Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-27T10:18:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T18:19:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1690113772.2020
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova, Northern Peninsula East, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Snow squalls continue in the lee of Lake Winnipeg this morning as cold west winds blow across the lake. Snow squall activity is expected to gradually weaken by the afternoon however further localized accumulations of up to 10 cm are possible by the time the snow tapers off. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-26T19:59:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T13:12:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3646175554.2020
Area: Poplar River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A frontal system is approaching from the southwest will cross the Yukon today. As it approaches, strong easterly winds of 70 to 100 km/h near the Richardson Mountains will develop. These winds combined with falling snow will give blizzard conditions to the area beginning this morning. Conditions will improve this evening as the system exits the territory. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T03:20:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T11:21:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2438172479.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. A frontal system moving into the southwest Yukon will spread additional snow from the southwestern Yukon to the central Yukon today. Snow will ease later this morning in the southwest as the system crosses the area but persist until this evening elsewhere. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T03:19:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T11:20:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2992073140.2020
Area: Dawson, Mayo, Beaver Creek, Pelly - Carmacks, Whitehorse, Faro - Ross River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T02:49:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T17:36:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1575710641.2020
Area: Highway 97 - Pine Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Storm-total snowfall amounts from 15 to 25 cm are expected by midday. A frontal system crossing the Yukon and northern BC will continue give snow to the region today. Snow is expected to ease for most areas this afternoon. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T02:49:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T17:40:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2978937775.2020
Area: Yellowhead, McGregor
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall amounts from 15 to 25 cm are expected through today. A frontal system, moving across the northern Gulf of Alaska is spreading significant snowfall amounts from central BC to the southern Yukon. The snow is expected to ease for most areas this afternoon as the front moves eastward. Another frontal system is expected to bring more snow to the Yellowhead region tonight through Tuesday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T03:23:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T11:24:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1465477249.2020
Area: Yellowhead, Williston, Prince George, McGregor, Muncho Lake Park - Stone Mountain Park, Watson Lake, Dease Lake, Cassiar Mountains, Teslin, Atlin
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: First significant early season snowfall tonight. Locations: northern New Brunswick. Time span: this afternoon and into early Tuesday morning. Remarks: A shot of snow already fell for parts of central and northern New Brunswick early this afternoon. More snow is again moving over northern New Brunswick this afternoon and will changeover to rain tonight over most regions before ending Tuesday morning. Total snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are expected however, more accumulation is likely over higher terrain where temperatures will be colder. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-27T10:50:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-26T18:51:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0809540164.2020

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Storm-total snowfall amounts from 15 to 25 cm are expected by midday. A frontal system crossing the Yukon and norther BC will continue give snow to the region this morning. Snow is expected to ease for most areas later this morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
